alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 29 at 12:20AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding remains possible through sunrise this morning. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following counties, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - As of 12 AM MDT, isolated thunderstorms have developed in far western Cheyenne county, Colorado. Additional thunderstorm development is possible early this morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
